comments.body: Isn't this the default after https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/13930? Would it be enough to say, "your cluster needs to allow the creation of privileged pods"? It seems like a bit of a rabbit hole to go into cluster setup in a user guide. Isn't "you should have the daemonset enabled" another similar prereq? That's even more important since it is not the default. I think you should mentions these prereqs but not explain how to implement them here.
I noticed it's default now with the privileged containers. I'll convert the explanation part into a short mention and add more details about enabling DaemonSet

@@ -1,1 +40,44 @@### Step 0: Prerequisites

This process will create priviliged containers which have full access to the host system for logging. Beware of the security implications of this.

If you are using a Salt based KUBERNETES\_PROVIDER (**gce**, **vagrant**, **aws**), you should make sure the creation of privileged containers via the API is enabled. Check `cluster/saltbase/pillar/privilege.sls`.
